intro: Eriocaulon olivaceum, commonly known as the olive-green rice sedge, is a flowering plant belonging to the family Cyperaceae. It is a perennial herb that typically grows in wetland or marshy environments, often found in tropical and subtropical regions. The plant has grass-like leaves and produces small, spike-like inflorescences that bear tiny flowers. Its rhizomes are often used in traditional medicine in some parts of its native range. The species is characterized by its pale green to yellowish coloration, which gives it its common name.
